timer.title: Timer
timer.aria-label_timerArea: Timer area of the escape game

welcome.intro: Experience in a playful way the challenges faced by people with digital disabilities.
welcome.rules: Before starting, choose your adventure and your nickname

intro.content_description: Introduction page of the escape game and first riddle
intro.descriptionText1: This escape game aims to offer you an immersive experience, making you particularly aware of the challenges faced by people with digital disabilities.
intro.descriptionText2: You will be plunged into a scenario in which you will play a character with different impairments at each new stage.

descriptionText3.end: solve riddles and challenges one by one, overcome obstacles related to accessibility and ergonomics to progress in the game.

intro.descriptionText4: It's up to you to get out, alone or in a group, against these difficulties.
intro.rule1: You have 60 minutes to go as far as possible (and hopefully finish). For screen reader users, a region has been positioned on the timer to make it easier for you to access, we're still nice!
intro.rule2: For each new stage, a riddle based on one or more impairment(s) will be stated.
intro.rule3: Each riddle has its own rules.
intro.rule4: All pages contain at least one little trickery on our part (hihihi).
intro.rule6: To level the playing field, the use of DevTools will be forgotten. We trust you!
intro.startButton: To begin, click on the link: here.

visual.content_description: Page describing visual impairment on color blindness
visual.descriptionText1: Navigating the internet is a challenge for a person with a visual impairment.
visual.descriptionText2: The online experience is highly dependent on assistive technologies (such as screen readers) that partially compensate for the disability, AND on HTML code that respects digital accessibility standards (WCAG) to interface correctly with the tools.
visual.userTypeHeading: The type of user you embody
visual.userTypeDescription: You are in the shoes of a colorblind person (severely affected). You therefore see no color or almost none... so when information is only conveyed by color as in the case of the 4 buttons at the bottom of the page, it is not accessible to you.
visual.rule1: Click on the buttons in a specific order: green, blue, red, and then purple to pass this stage.
visual.rule2: Be careful, if you make a mistake you will have to start all over again!
visual.errorMessage: Oops, wrong color! You must follow the instructions, come on!!...

visualSimu.content_description: Page simulating a severe visual impairment (blindness)
visualSimu.userTypeText1: This challenge is a bit special. To navigate with the keyboard on this page, use the "Tab" key to move forward and the "Shift+Tab" combination to move backward.
visualSimu.userTypeText2: Here, you are facing the most impacting digital disability: blind or very visually impaired.
visualSimu.riddleText1: Hard to know where you're going in the dark, huh?
visualSimu.riddleText3: And then, it's very easy to enter values into a form
visualSimu.riddleText5: You just have to know WHAT to enter...
visualSimu.riddleText7: I'm nice, I'll leave a label on the form fields.
visualSimu.riddleText8: And then, if there were to be dates, they would be in the format yyyy/mm/dd... that's for sure.
visualSimu.riddleText10: I, Louis, had to work with all my strength so that my disability would not hinder me
visualSimu.riddleText11: (my father told me I had thick skin)
visualSimu.riddleText12: I put a POINT of honor to work on it, invent and perfect my system.
visualSimu.riddleText13: In any case, the result is there, my invention has survived me and has become the standard.
visualSimu.riddleText14: I was even moved during my rest as a personality...
visualSimu.formInstructions: Enter your answers in the following form fields:
visualSimu.validationError: Ouch, the test is still not successful, you cannot validate the challenge!!!
visualSimu.name: braille
visualSimu.congratulations: Congratulations!!! You can press the "Enter" key to move on to the next challenge!!!
visualSimu.error: Ouch, the test is still not successful, you cannot validate the challenge!!!

cognitive.descriptionText1: Dyslexia is a learning disorder that affects reading, writing, and understanding of words.
cognitive.descriptionText2: People with dyslexia have difficulties when navigating the web.
cognitive.descriptionText3: Prolonged reading on a screen leads to increased visual fatigue and complex design elements. Garish colors or animations can also distract.
cognitive.userTypeHeading: The type of user you embody
cognitive.userTypeText: You are in the shoes of a person with dyslexia. So you have difficulties reading and, on top of that, a "slight" attention disorder.
cognitive.rule1: Read carefully, and answer the riddles correctly
cognitive.rule2: To start the simulation, just click on the link containing the exact following phrase:
cognitive.rule3: "Yes, it's certain, this link is the right one"
cognitive.rule4: Be careful, an error and the page will be refreshed!!!
buttonsLabels: yes it's certain, this link is the right one
yes of course, with some ham
yes it's hard, this link is a round
yes it's bad, here's a candy

cognitiveSimu.content_description: Page describing visual impairment on color blindness
cognitiveSimu.riddle1: My first did not hold his tongue and wore a mustache, even if it must be put into perspective, it was much more common at the time... In any case, we can say that he put a new definition of mass and his discoveries were a revolution.
cognitiveSimu.riddle2: My second is the queen of crime, whether with a Poirot or her pen, her composure has marked (one might even say printed) her imprint on the detective genre.
cognitiveSimu.riddle3: My third evolved from his birth in 1809 to his death in 1882, even though he is the instigator of a theory on the origin of species, natural selection is the same for everyone, after all.
cognitiveSimu.errorMessage: Ouch Ouch Ouch, the answers are not correct!!!

physical.content_description: Page describing motor impairment and simulation of mouse use with such a disability
physical.descriptionText1: People with motor impairments encounter various obstacles when navigating the Internet.
physical.descriptionText2: These obstacles are often related to a limited ability to control mouse movements precisely, to perform keyboard key combinations, or to execute sequential movements.
physical.userTypeHeading: The type of users you embody
physical.userTypeText: You are in the shoes of a person with a motor impairment, so you have great difficulty moving your mouse and navigating.

physicalSimu.content_description: Page simulating a motor impairment with the use of the keyboard
physicalSimu.userTypeText1: You are a person with a motor impairment.
physicalSimu.userTypeText2: You do not fully control your fingers. It is therefore not easy for you to type precisely on the keys of a keyboard.
physicalSimu.hint1: You will indicate in the form field the first and last name of a great man
physicalSimu.hint2: A great British physicist and cosmologist.
physicalSimu.hint3: Affected by amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, he continued to work until his death in 2018.
physicalSimu.hint4: Type the correct answer in the form field.
physicalSimu.hint5: Pssst, don't repeat it, but the correct answer is "Stephen Hawking"... Shh, shh, shh, it's a secret.
physicalSimu.errorMessage: Ouch Ouch Ouch, the answer is incorrect!!!

hearing.descriptionText1: A person with hearing impairments has an alteration in their ability to hear or perceive sounds normally.
hearing.descriptionText2: There are several levels of hearing loss, ranging from mild to severe, or even total.
hearing.descriptionText3: To meet the needs of people with hearing loss, it is important to implement appropriate solutions.
hearing.userTypeHeading: The type of user you embody
hearing.userTypeText2: Information transmitted by videos or audio tracks is not very useful without subtitles, audio descriptions, or text transcriptions.
hearing.userTypeText3: By chance, a miracle gradually restores your hearing... in exchange for a bit of your time.
hearing.rule1: 5 audio files can be played, below.
hearing.rule2: The first sound is active, the others will appear one after the other after the complete listening of the previous sound.
hearing.rule3: The sound improves each time, following the level of decibel loss defined by the 4 levels of deafness.
hearing.rule4: Each sound gives the correct answer.
hearing.rule5: One last detail... impatience leads to refreshing... hihihi
hearing.errorMessage: Make an effort, are you sure you heard correctly?

hearingSimu.errorMessage: It's a miss, listen to the video again carefully!!!

form.content_description: Registration form page for Tota11y Lost
form.descriptionText1: Forms are ubiquitous on the Web.
form.descriptionText2: Therefore, it is impossible to do without them, and they must be easily usable by everyone.
form.descriptionText3: Here you will try to correctly fill out this registration form.
form.userTypeHeading: The type of user you embody
form.userTypeText: You are in the shoes of someone suffering from cognitive or visual impairment, thus often faced with forms that are not or poorly accessible.
form.rule1: Fill in all the form fields (you can enter fictional data!!!).
form.rule3: Once the form is validated, you will be able to validate the riddle.
form.rule4: If it's too hard, don't hesitate to take hints!!!
form.rule5: Be careful, hints add time to your timer...
hints: Yes indeed, it's not easy to fill out a form when there are no labels... Labels have now been added.
It can be frustrating not to know why you can't validate a form. Always allow the possibility to validate the form and add error messages!!!

It's all well and good to have an error message, but if it's not precise, it will be of no use. Error messages must be precise and linked to the form fields to quickly determine the error. And voila, error messages have been added.
form.errorPassword: The password must be between 4 and 8 characters
form.errorAge: The age must be a number less than 18
form.errorEmail: The email format is not valid. Example format: firstname.lastname@orange.com
form.errorPhoneNumber: The phone number format is not valid. Example format: +33612345678

formSimu.content_description: Simulation page of a form with a visual impairment (zoom at 500%+)
formSimu.information:
You are visually impaired, you use a software magnifier at 500% to help you navigate.
Having the entirety of a website's information becomes difficult...
Your goal will be to navigate this site, find the form fields, and fill them out correctly.
The continuation is in the next element, to the right.
-->
formSimu.tooltip:
Sorry, lack of space... we were cut off.
So I was saying,
it obviously becomes an additional challenge to read this kind of tooltips.
If only this message would stop disappearing...
It would be simpler!
Go on... I think everyone must have zoomed out by now, this field is actually not mandatory ;p
formSimu.navigation:
To pass this step, you will simply need to hover over each tooltip next to the form fields, read the content, and answer the riddles.
Easy then.
The continuation is in the next element, to the left
<--
formSimu.lastPoint:
One last little point.
Don't forget, everything is big here, you will have to travel a bit to find the form fields...
The continuation is in the next element, to the left
<--
formSimu.tooltipRiddle1:
Riddle 1:
We are looking for a Name
- I was born a slave in Dorchester County.
- A head injury caused me a visual impairment.
- I am known for having been an abolitionist, escorting 300 slaves to freedom.
formSimu.aria-label_solveRiddle1: Solve the riddle and indicate the name of the person sought
formSimu.aria-describedby_solveRiddle1: Riddle: I was born a slave in Dorchester County. A head injury caused me a visual impairment. I am known for having been an abolitionist, escorting 300 slaves to freedom.
formSimu.tooltipRiddle2:
Riddle 2:
What to put in this form field?
... The answer is much simpler.
If only this message would stop disappearing...
It would be simpler!
Go on... I think everyone must have zoomed out by now, this field is actually not mandatory in fact ;p

scores.congratulations: Congratulations, you have finished the Escape Game!
scores.toKnowMore: To learn more, visit our recommendations site.
scores.alt_congratulationImage: You have finished the escape game in {{version}} minutes
